content: Can you provide a Python code to extract 6 novels published in the 21st century from a JSON file containing information about books? The JSON file contains the following keys: "title", "author", "year", "genre".

Certainly! To extract novels published in the 21st century from a JSON file, you can use the following Python code. This script assumes that the JSON data is structured as a list of dictionaries, where each dictionary represents a book with keys for "title", "author", "year", and "genre".

```python
import json

def extract_21st_century_novels(json_data):
    # Filter for novels published in the 21st century
    novels_21st_century = [
        book for book in json_data
        if book.get('year') and isinstance(book['year'], int) and book['year'] >= 2000
    ]

    # Select the first 6 novels
    return novels_21st_century[:6]

# Sample JSON data
json_data = [
    {"title": "Novel 1", "author": "Author A", "year": 1999, "genre": "Fiction"},
    {"title": "Novel 2", "author": "Author B", "year": 2001, "genre": "Fiction"},
    {"title": "Novel 3", "author": "Author C", "year": 2005, "genre": "Fiction"},
    {"title": "Novel 4", "author": "Author D", "year": 2010, "genre": "Fiction"},
    {"title": "Novel 5", "author": "Author E", "year": 2015, "genre": "Fiction"},
    {"title": "Novel 6", "author": "Author F", "year": 2020, "genre": "Fiction"},
    {"title": "Novel 7", "author": "Author G", "year": 2021, "genre": "Fiction"},
    {"title": "Novel 8", "author": "Author H", "year": 2022, "genre": "Fiction"},
]

# Assuming the JSON data is loaded into the variable json_data
novels_21st_century = extract_21st_century_novels(json_data)

# Output the result
for novel in novels_21st_century:
    print(f"Title: {novel['title']}, Author: {novel['author']}, Year: {novel['year']}")

```

This code will filter all the novels published from the year 2000 onwards and select the first six of them. You can replace the `json_data` with actual data from your JSON file. Make sure to load the JSON content using `json.load()` if you are reading from a file.
